Trust us. We’re experts. That has been the unstated message for health data scientists for decades. Even though multi-billion-dollar decisions rely on the strength of the evidence being produced in scientific journals on levels and trends in health, scientists have expected those decision-makers to swallow a certain amount of murkiness when it comes to the completeness and quality of the evidence upon which their decisions must be based. JUNE AWARENESS MONTH: ALZHEIMER’S and BRAIN AWARENESS Doctor Evidence has digital data assets from published clinical research across a wide variety of disease states, including approximately 400 studies on this month’s special awareness topics, Alzheimer's and brain awareness, with more studies digitized daily.
GROWTH Value is the newest offering from the GROWTH division of Doctor Evidence. It offers payers, pharmacy benefits managers, and other healthcare industry stakeholders a transparent, trusted resource for evidence-based coverage decisions. GROWTH Value compliments other evidence products from the GROWTH division of Doctor Evidence, including GROWTH Research and GROWTH Evidence. GROWTH Value generates data tables that take advantage of the experience, quality, and attention to detail of the Doctor Evidence technology platform and highly skilled teams.
GROWTH Value treatment analysis tables are prepared for organizations that need evidence quickly but without the rigor required of a full systematic review. These tables contain efficacy, safety, and cost data to support coverage decisions and treatment protocols.
Conferences
For over 30 years, AcademyHealth's Annual Research Meeting (ARM) has been the premier forum for health services research (HSR). The largest meeting of its kind, the ARM convenes the foremost experts at the intersection of health, health care, and policy to share important findings and showcase the latest research on how the health system works, what it costs, and how to improve it. July Commentary: 2017 GROWTH Commentary Series: US Agency for International Development (USAID) By Kelly Saldana, MPIA, MPH
Doctor Evidence has partnered with the Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation (IHME) to increase the accuracy and reliability of healthcare utilization estimates and economic forecasts. The powerful technologies of Doctor Evidence, combined with the comprehensive Global Burden of Disease epidemiological data of IHME, will be integrated into real-world evidence data hubs to support clinical guidelines, health technology assessments, and comparative effectiveness analyses. Visionaries like the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation will utilize these combined resources and knowledge to forecast both healthcare needs and policies or interventions that demonstrate effectiveness in alleviating those burdens. The result will be improved healthcare strategy from start to finish, guided by efficient and targeted analyses and conclusions.
